ume, subscribers will be furnished gratis, With
a general index ofthe contents, and handsome
ly engraved titlepsge.


Price Of subscription 50 so per annum, paya-
BILE in advance. Postmasters and others out of
the CITY, procuring FIVE subscribers and becom-
ing responsible for the payment, will be entitled
to sixth copy gratis.


The Copper-platc embellishments will be SUI
perintended by the publisher, and the typo
graphical part ofthis work will be under the ex-
elusive direction of Messrs. Atkinson & Alexan.
der, who have been so long known TO the public
as able and enterprising srtizsns, that it is en-.
tircly unnecessary to say that so far as they are
concerned, there can be no doubt as to the ell
eeance of its execution; and with regard to his
own share Of the arrangements, the publisher
binds himself, in case he should fail to perform
any essential part of his undertaking to refunt
the price of subscription.

The spacious and elegant house belonging TO
the Company, which was completed last ii'ii, Is
now open and handsomely furnished for the re-
ception Of visitors and boarders, under inc su-
pcrintendcncc of the Subscriber.


This WATEniSG pLAcE is tlnely situated IN
the high and healthy country, i've miles west OF
Wilmington, commanding an extensive view OF
the surrounding country, the River Delaware ana
the ncighhoring States. The grounds OF thc
company afford pleasant and shady pFoinenAdeS'
and arc bounded by fine streams.


The virtues Of the Waters arc those o' the pur-
est Chal, beatc, according to the analysis or FRO
fessor Keating, of Philadelphia. They have been
particularly ctfieacous IN bilious and other -
yers, and are celebrated as a inc tome.


The vicinity 10 Wilmington, Offers al all t.incs-
access to AN excellent market; and the daily IN
tercoursc by steam Boat lines between that
place and New Castle, to and from Philadelphia
and baltimore, affords a facility OF comnrmca'
ton not possessed BY any other Watering Place

with dinners, colIAtioas, Ice creams, &c S<c.

full articles.headline: TERTTs.
full articles.article:
"THE SOUVENIR" will be published every
WEDNESDAY,, on extra-uedium fine white
paper, printed with new and elegant type, and
decorated, in addition to the engrayings alluded
TO above, with many appropriate Embellishments
Each number will comprise eight pages, cut,
stitched and expressly adapted for bind ng. At
the expiration of every year, or the close ofa vol
ume, subscribers will be furnished gratis, With
a general index ofthe contents, and handsome
ly engraved titlepsge.


Price Of subscription 50 so per annum, paya-
BILE in advance. Postmasters and others out of
the CITY, procuring FIVE subscribers and becom-
ing responsible for the payment, will be entitled
to sixth copy gratis.


The Copper-platc embellishments will be SUI
perintended by the publisher, and the typo
graphical part ofthis work will be under the ex-
elusive direction of Messrs. Atkinson & Alexan.
der, who have been so long known TO the public
as able and enterprising srtizsns, that it is en-.
tircly unnecessary to say that so far as they are
concerned, there can be no doubt as to the ell
eeance of its execution; and with regard to his
own share Of the arrangements, the publisher
binds himself, in case he should fail to perform
any essential part of his undertaking to refunt
the price of subscription.


PHILLLP PRICE Jr. Philadelplsia.


Subscriptions will be received al
this Office, where a specimen o.
the Work may be seen.
